Pros:
- Has good music
- Cheap (aka free but with the option of 2 DLC's that bring new music)
- Timer is cute honestly
- Options for white noise
- The cat
- The dog
- Can pause/restart the timer

Cons:
- I wish we had the option to change between the timer and a stopwatch
- takes up a lot of space, on the screen and can get in the way of my work when i'm switching between apps
- no way of tracking statistics in app

Suggestions:
I think for me, when I minimize the actual app, I wish there's like a small window that stays at the very top in like the layers of apps, so like whenever you have a task and you switch between them, you don't lose the timer and it get stuck behind the app that you're currently using. This could also be just an option for popout or when you exit the app and just minimizes it to the tray and you're just left with the floating window. 

But that's just my opinion and I can definitely see that this app is meant to be minimalistic and not to be overwhelming to users.

I love love LOVE this app honestly, the music, so calming. The graphics, cute af, and the clock SYNCS UP TO MY SYSTEM CLOCK. Also, really love the DLC's, thank you for the wonderful work you guys are doing, keep it up. 
So yeah definitely recommend, especially since this game is Free.99

147106545.review:
Virtual Cottage has been a life saver, i downloaded it when i started my degree a couple of years ago and have used it almost constantly to keep track of my daily obligations. 
ive been hit with a lot of questions on why ive been playing this random game so much and its because it was one of the few things that was genuinely helping me with daily time management. I have now completed a degree and i partially hold this app responsible for that.
if you have ADHD or some other issues with managing your time and prioritising your obligations i highly recommend that you download and play around with Virtual Cottage. 
breaking down big tasks into small tasks and slowly executing is the best way to achieve goals and this is what the app helps you do.

In the future id love to see the following 
- Options to import your own music (Spotify compatibility or something) 
- More advanced scheduling and time management options 
- The ability to save the to do lists that have been made (this has been the biggest drawback of using this as a study aid, i have had to resort to using whiteboards to track the execution of larger goals)
-more interface customisation 

Im going to rate this app a 7/10 once it has the update it is in need of it will have potential to be one of the best study aids out there.

143671527.review:
Virtual Cottage is a very simple and cozy little tool to create a sense of focus and coworking. It's a very minimalist experience - there's no pomodoro timers or tracking tools or even a personalized playlist. You get a nice set of music selected by the "house" as it were (you can refine it to exclude songs you don't like), and the ability to set the atmosphere of your office space. It's very light weight, which means you can run it on the same computer you're working on, even if you've got a bit of a potato. 

I find actual virtual coworking often more distracting than helpful, so this is perfect. The person in the cottage never starts tapping their pencil or exclaims in ways that just beg for me to ask what's up. We're just both working quietly next to each other, and I can have a crackling fireplace without nearly as many emissions!

I wanted to get all the achievements as soon as possible, but as I carried on, it just became normal to have this running in the background while I did what I needed to do. It adds a nice ambiance with the warm tones, the cute avatar and cat, and the white noises like rain or a fire place. I did enjoy the music on the game, but prefer my own. I loved this game and I highly recommend it to my ADHD friends who need a buddy to help keep an eye on them :)

I do hope for future updates, like more achievements or more customisation, but I also understand that the name of the game is simplicity, and if its too customisable, players would spent too much time on that, rather than the activities they need to focus on

Would recommend for people who need to focus or want a body-double.
I've named her Gail, she works on her own stuff while keeping me company.

Like: 
* The Chill Lo-fi Music
* The ability to change the white noise.
* The To Do List.
* The cosy atmosphere.
* IT'S FREE. (Super cool of them)

Would Improve:
* Make the alarm sound adjustable, it's too low for me to hear and it stops too soon.
* It would be nice to name our little buddy in the game.
* LET US PET THE DOG. <3
* Adjustable background colours.
* Let us Save our to-do list when the app is closed, and possibly have multiple lists saved for study and housework.

Disliked:
* The app doesn't SAVE your to-do list upon closing.

While I hesitate to call this a game, it is a wonderful little app, great for ADHD, chill vibes in the background and did I mention IT'S FREE?!

To the devs, thank you for creating this, and if you ever expand it with more features and the ability to save stuff, I'd be willing to pay.

137720824.review:
Exactly what I needed to fight with my procrastination. I hate silence at home, I get easily distracted and while doing household chores or just preparing for another day at work, I MUST listen to music. Used to play good old rock or even heavy metal, but have never been fully convinced about lo-fi.

[b]THE GAMEPLAY[/b]
Well... it's not completely a game. It's simply an app. You can customize the titular virtual cottage by setting the weather - with sounds! - and adding the pets, namely a cat or a dog. If the clock is set correctly, the day changes as well. All your experience with this app is about writing a to-do list, setting the amount of time you want to devote, setting the playlist and enjoying your work while listening to some relaxing music. [i]Virtual Cottage[/i] gets constantly upgraded, so I bet there will be more features. For now, the fact I can finally set my favourite songs to play is enough. [i]Moonlit[/i] by TESK and nothing else matters.

[b]THE GRAPHICS[/b]
Lovely, full of warm colors. They definitely set the mood. Even during winter. If there's an event to happen - like Halloween or Christmas - you can see the decorations added, such as pumpkins or lights.

[b]THE SUMMARY[/b]
Need more focus on reading, studying, doing household chores or preparing stuff to leave for work? [i]Virtual Cottage[/i] is a perfect choice. You won't hear any aggressive sounds, it's all around the tones which make you chilled out. I can confirm that with [i]Virtual Cottage[/i] playing in the background, my workdays start pretty nice. Moreover, it's a very good app for home dates.

136122483.review:
I enjoy this game. Whenever I'm doing homework I put this on my second monitor partially for vibes and partially to prevent myself from putting a YouTube video there and getting distracted. I've been using it for a while and enjoying it, but I have a few issues/suggestions with it. 

1) I wish there was more personalizing options when it comes to the layout. I like the details of the color changing with the time, and how cute the house looks, but other than that, it feels very empty. I think some nice additions would be giving more options with color, the person at the keyboard, possibly even the house layout. I do like how the current one looks, but adding more variety would make it more appealing to those who get bored easily. 

2) The music selection is too small. Because I've gone through the same selection of songs for so long, I've resorted to muting the music and playing my own music in the background, but using the rain/fire sounds that are given on the screen. This isn't hard to do, but I think expanding the music selection would be nice. What a lot of people would probably enjoy would be a way to link a music application to the game so they're able to shuffle through or play their own playlist through the game, whether it be Apple Music, Spotify, or YouTube Music. That being said, the current songs given are still very pleasant, and I love the features for weather sounds. 

This isn't critique, but I love the To-Do feature. It's a cute way to organize my tasks homework wise, and the timer is useful if I want to take water breaks or if I have laundry / chores to do while working. It also doesn't ruin the aesthetic of the screen, and blends in well with the game. 

I enjoy how this game is currently, but I believe I'd use it even more if the developers updated it.

This is a really cute game (program?) to have running in the background while I study. I have ADHD and need background noise or I just can't focus, and a lot of the things I've tried either don't work or get unceremoniously interrupted by ads. This works and has no ads! :D

I'll probably be using this for all of my future study time, now.

I like that you can choose what animal friend you have around the person on screen, and that you can adjust what background sounds you have. I sort of wish you could layer them, I'd like to play raining and windy at the same time to simulate the sound of a storm, but there's also a lot of rain where I am right now, and it's not like I can't also put on a video elsewhere of a storm, so I'm not missing out on a lot. Different alarm sounds would be nice, too, because the beeping tends to make me jump. These aren't complaints - just suggestions. I actually really can't complain about Virtual Cottage, it's seriously helping me focus. I put it fullscreen'd on my second screen so I'm not tempted to wander off on YouTube or something and not study. 

I also like the achievements for how much time you spend studying, I find they're quite motivational. 

10/10 game.

Este juego (Si se podría decirle así, es mas una EXPERIENCIA INTERACTIVA Y SENSORIAL) es EXCELENTE.
Es la experiencia perfecta a la hora de trabajar, estudiar o realizar cualquier cosa y tener de fondo en tu vida diaria.
La posibilidad de modificar el clima, el sonido de ambiente y la música es muy relajante. Definitivamente te ayuda a concentrarte en la tarea que estas haciendo.
Tiene la posibilidad de crear una Lista de Tareas para mantenerte organizad@ y hasta podes elegir si tu compañero es un gato o perro.
La única critica que realizo es que talvez podría ser mas customizable en el sentido de elegir el personaje y cambiar ciertas cosas en la habitación, pero nada que deje de hacer de esta una "experiencia" y lo convierta en un juego, porque es algo que no quiere ser.
Actualmente estoy estudiando una Licenciatura en historia y esta es una forma perfecta de volver ludico algo que capas sea tedioso como el estudio de algún apunte o tema que no nos guste.
En resumen, es una experiencia hermosa, que toda persona deberia experimentar por al menos 30min.

133293940.review:
Virtual Cottage is an incredibly addictive and immersive game that I couldn't stop playing. The gameplay is simple yet engrossing, allowing me to design and decorate my dream cottage in a virtual world. With each level, I became more and more invested in the game, constantly trying to improve my designs and beat my own high scores.

Little did I know, my obsession with Virtual Cottage would indirectly help me gain admission to Harvard University not once, but seven times. As I poured hours into perfecting my virtual cottage, I found myself developing a newfound passion for design and architecture. This passion translated into real-world activities, such as participating in school design competitions and volunteering for local community projects.

My experiences with Virtual Cottage helped me build a strong and unique extracurricular profile, which ultimately caught the attention of Harvard's admissions committee. I was thrilled to receive my first acceptance letter from Harvard, and over the next few years, I found myself being admitted to the prestigious university again and again.

In summary, Virtual Cottage may not be a direct ticket to Harvard, but it certainly helped me develop important skills and interests that ultimately led to my multiple admissions. I highly recommend this game to anyone looking for a fun and engaging way to explore their creative side.

A very chill and atmospheric game. Though I wouldn't really call this much of a game and more of a study buddy. 
Not only are the visuals very cute and appealing, the sounds also add a cozy and relaxing vibe. 
While working on my computer, I like to open Virtual Cottage on my second Monitor. On one hand because the game is extremely useful to set a study Timer and keep track of time as well as keeping an overview which tasks are still on your to do list and on the other hand keeping this open on your second monitor (if you have one) is a great way to fight the temptation to get distracted by other thing you COULD be watching on your other monitor as well (for example Netflix or Youtube).
Besides the visual help, the sounds also provide an excellent study setting with a great assortment of relaxing but not distracting Lofi Soundtracks and sound effects such as rain tapping on your window or a fireplace crackling beside you. Even if I don't work at my computer, I enjoy letting Virtual Cottage run in the background while reading or cleaning simply because it creates such a pleasant environment. 

10/10 game! 
A strong recommendation for any student that has trouble focusing sometimes!

Picture this scenario: You are at home and you need to focus for your exams that are coming soon or you work from home in a remote job. You have at your disposal many distractions, one of them could be Steam which you could open a game from a click away. You may have dual monitors while working and the temptation to just open a game while the work sits on the other screen is real.
 
This is when Virtual Cottage comes to play. You decide not to try and ignore that Steam temptation but you do actually open it and actually go to your library and start a game, this one. And now you have at your disposal a realistic goal that you are going to set for yourself (try to be honest with yourself). You set a time to focus, 60 minutes, 30 minutes, 1 hour, it’s up to you. If it’s cold outside the fireplace will give you an extra comfy feeling not only for the looks but from the sounds from cracking wood as well. You can do the same for wind, snow and rain as well. Are you finding a certain track too distracting or you prefer no music at all? The sound of rain, wind, snow or the sound coming from the fireplace can be everything you need then, just turn down the music volume and you’re set.
 
Are you a dog person? A cute dog will stay around you while you focus. A cat person? A cat buddy is available as well with a simple click.

As you go on with your study or work you feel you need to have a checklist of things? You can add or remove them by having them on the left side of your cottage. 

So, as you can see, you can have Steam while studying or working and instead of being a cruel distraction it can become an ally to reach your goals with a soft, relaxing mood. There’s no rush, no stress, grab your headset select the sound of nature or mix them with the music provided and you’re good to go. Yes, you could just open a browser or an app and select any music you would like but with Virtual Cottage you have a mix of relaxing music combined with the sounds of wind, snow, fireplace or rain, a check list to keep your goals in place, a timer set by yourself that you can change or reset at any time and finally, the temptation to open steam is gone. It’s already there, being busy playing this game to keep you focused.

Give it a try!

It does what it says. Be aware that this is just a timer with nice music, optional ambient sounds, and a to-do list option with no real "game" elements. What's nice is that you can pause the music, mix the ambient sounds, or even exclude specific songs. The fire/wind/rain/snow sounds are high quality, sound very real, and you don't hear them loop or pause or anything, as is sometimes the case with ambient noise or rain playlists elsewhere.
There are no easter eggs, mini games or anything else to do, since this is strictly productivity focused.
I recommend buying the DLC because those songs are really good and it adds some variety.

For achievement hunters who think this is an easy game to 100% for your stats, please be aware that it says "Profile Features Limited" on this store page. It won't count towards your achievement stats or perfect game record and cannot be displayed in some showcases.

I use this game to help fill the void (not really void, read on) of my ADHD brain while on zoom classes (online courses) + working on homework. My brain is typically filled with so many thoughts but this game helps to bring a calm to the storm, and align some focus in my day to day activities. I like that I can just enable the fire crackling and rain sounds, having the option to pause the music and play your own on the side if you prefer (sometimes i'll open up youtube or apple music on the side). No paywall, just free lo-fi vibes accompanied by optional ASMR & cute styled graphics (you can also choose a dog or cat to be by your side). The "To-Do" list is also a great interactive part, and you can set timers for yourself + add an optional title for your studying sequence. My brain enjoys "Ticking/checking off" completed things! I may just have to grab the new partnership DLC that was recently released for some new Lo-fi to love! :) - Enjoying the new music selection option released in a recent update, easily turn on and off specific music to your taste. 

Definitely recommend! Little thing: love the little achievements for different amount of time spent "playing." So close to getting the final achievement, "100hrs" - Keep up the good work, happy studying!
- rubadub

122886263.review:
as a veteran user of various focus apps, this is easily one of the better ones. It is cozy, relaxing, and low-key, while also having a decent amount of functionality built in. As a glorified focus timer, it works well.

I would like to see a bit more done with the concept of a cottage- for example, furniture and decor options, as well as paint and flooring options. This would also help with gamifying and motivation- for example, a store could be added to buy different furnishings, and coins/currency could be earned through focus time.

However, as-is, the game is perfectly fine. Though not as motivating as some other apps (which often have gamifying elements to them) it still delivers well on a lower-key and low stakes focus timer. I find that it works best when used in tandem with other focus apps, instead of as a complete solution.

edit: after several more hours in-game, my previous comments still stand. However, after reading some comments and posts by the devs, I understand why gamifying the app is, for the most part, unachievable. However, a few different customization options would still go a long way. After spending more time in the game, I would most like to be able to access statistics (to-dos completed, time focused, etc), track time focused for different goals, and change the avatar's appearance. These things would create more functionality, personalization, and motivation, while requiring no massive currency systems or complete overhauls of the game.

122137915.review:
This isn't really a game - it's more of an aesthetically packaged lofi station app. That said, it's helped a lot with my productivity. I've tried using those 3 hour lofi hiphop mixes on YouTube, but the constant ads bothered me a lot, and just setting it up was a "try not to get distracted" challenge for me because I'd take any chance to put off my studying/work and would just watch whatever caught my eye in my recommended feed. 

I've been finding it really simple to get into a flow state with my work by entering my virtual cottage. When I'm not referencing a textbook or a slideshow on screen, I keep the app in full screen to help me focus better. Also, the to-do list function and timer really helps me narrow my focus and stick to pomodoro-style studying sessions. I really do appreciate how the setting is dynamic - the scene shifts depending on your time of day. Gotta acknowledge how the aesthetic lofi girl has tan skin, a decent effort for diversity. 

The ambient sound effects are simple to control, and the songs have minimal lyrics, which is another plus for someone who gets distracted easily. The only complaint I have is that there aren't a huge selection of songs, so I find that if I've been studying for more than an hour, I start getting bored of hearing the same tunes over and over again.

Overall, if you're a student or someone who needs to get stuff done but is easily distracted, give it a try! It's literally free, what do you have to lose?

121036918.review:
First of all. This game is very helpful when I want to work on my art commissions. Very chill music and a nice setting to look at. I like to change the weather on the program to match with the weather outside my window. I usually use Youtube clips of game music or chill music people would upload into 2-3 hour long clips. This is basically the same if you really want to get something done.

As for the negatives:
- Needs more songs to listen to. If this is a game you are giving people to use to keep them on track. Having A LOT of songs (countless even!) can help keep the person onboard to use it more often instead of getting bored. Even just beach sounds, ocean sounds, nature or forest sounds or chatter as music options can be super nice. I know I enjoy listening to the waves of the ocean for hours on end when working.
- The character in the room is a female. Perhaps give more options for the choice of gender or diversity between groups to allow for a more personal look for players to use the program and to feel more at home like this game is a little part of them. Having room for design or change can make the player feel more connected/attached.
- Don't get me wrong, it is an adorable game and I adore it but having more individually items/assets can go A LONG way depending on what you do with them with your targeted audience.

As for what I wish this game had more of:
- Upgrades to decorate your cottage room space depending on the hours you have the game running when in use.
- More options for pets (birds, hamsters and etc).
- Different colours to pick from for tables, chairs and what not to paint or change.
- Even allowing players to completely CHANGE the whole room from top to bottom can have many decorating it for hours to appeal to them and what speaks out to them.
- Maybe even changing the coat of animals/pets in the room or have many you can have in the room.
- Allow for the room to EXPAND. Wouldn't it be great to see the space GROW depending on how many hours pass by to reward you with more space to decorate and put together for staying on top of your studies/tasks/etc????

Basically what I am saying is. Reward the player with customisation options/rewards so the space they are looking at appeals more to them, their personality and character. I know this game is meant to be strictly to keep one on task but these kinds of people who concentrate on studies as a whole are most likely people who want something nice to look at or create.

This is a very good game; I could leave it off at that but may as well not. Virtual Cottage is really good for just about anything, you want to do read? You can do that. You want to just relax? You can do that also! Basically anything that you want to do with lofi music or just some background noise Virtual Cottage will be great for. Personally I've been using it to get my sleep schedule back on track but I plan on shifting that to studying once school starts.

Features: first off we got toggles for background noise, this includes a fireplace, wind, snow, and rain sounds each one you're able to control the volume, but you can only have two ambient sounds playing at one time, and that is the fireplace and one of the other ambient sounds. You can also create a to-do list and you're also able to cross out things you've accomplished. I do however wish there was a bigger library of music cause after only being in it for a little bit you'll be able to recognize every song. I also wish there was some sort of menu where you could create your own shortcuts for like pausing the music and other stuff. Overall I feel like they need one dedicated update for adding in songs and another dedicated update for those menu options to make sure everything is all polished. 

I have noticed some bad things about it. The performance is really good most of the time and doesn't seem to be affected by normal audio but whenever I use my bluetooth headphones the audio will be slightly glitchy which would be fine, but for most of the time I like having my headphones on to block out most other distracting noises.

TL;DR: Overall it's a really good tool to use for anything you need to get done or to just relax with very few and minor bugs. And may need a few more features.

So this game is basically like watching Lo-Fi girl on Youtube, except its in a nice little game window and you can adjust sound levels of the ambience, which is amazing!
It's pretty simple. You sit and listen to calming lo-fi music and ambience while a little girl studies at her desk with her dog/cat.
One thing I think is DEFINITELY missing from this simple little 'game' is the option to customise the character/room.
I reckon it would be a nice reward that if you sit and study/do what you're doing for x number of hours, you can unlock items to decorate your space.
To avoid distractions, the decorate your space options could only be available while setting up your timer, instead of while you're supposed to be concentrating.
Just a little suggestion to make this game all the more neat!
I honestly wouldn't even mind paying a small amount for the game if it were customisable - up to £5 I'd say!

120437753.review:
Great little productivity idea. Pop it on while I’m working/cleaning or just generally having some chill out time. 

The To do list feature is so SO helpful, I love lists and the fact the game has achievements for time spent in the app/game and being productive, because who wants to be productive all the time? Not me certainly. Just the right little dose of dopamine to get me through some tasks.

I’m only mad I discovered this now instead of when it was first released. Could’ve used this during my “spaceship you” time during lockdown. Would love to see the game devs work on it a bit more or release a premium/paid version of this. 

I’m obviously not a game developer but these are few things I LOVE and not so love about this little app.  

PROS
- Music is all Low-Fi which is proven to reduce stress and enhance focus. Also, what is it about low-fi music being like a brain massage? Just me?

- Can have just ambience sounds like rain, wind, fire crackling and snow? I guess. I live in Australia so the snow thing is kind of weird to me but I like you can shut off the music. 

- The task list is a great idea to have inside the app especially if you want to jot down some key things you want to get done during your session.
 
CONS (but not really cons?)
- Would be helpful if the “Activity” you are focusing on could be put in your Steam status as a sub status somehow, just to help minimise distractions or let others know what you are doing. 

- Task-list disappears when you close the app, you can pause or stop the session and the task-list stays though so that’s good! Just make sure you don’t want to save any tasks for later before closing. 

- Music seems to be a bit repetitive, could just be a licensing thing. Could just mute the app and play other types of music at the same time through paid streaming services though. So yeah, still not mad. 

Overall given the app is currently free and not perfect, I am in love and would be genuinely interested in a premium or paid version of this in the future.

10/10

118778115.review:
Takes inspiration from the popular ChilledCow/Lofi Girl livestream channel, and though technically (barely) more featured, is substantially less dynamic for the overlapping purpose.

What you can do:
• Listen to about 20 lo-fi, probably freely licensed tracks from about 10 artists
• Set a timer
• Write a to-do list
• Toggle cat/dog pet
• Toggle four weather effects and adjust their SFX volume

What you can't do:
• Customize your character
• Move your character
• Customize your cottage
• Customize your pet
• Move your pet
• Remove your pet

The application (not a game) is free, so it's hard to complain. But the device you run it on better covers all the functionality that isn't better covered by a tab running Lofi Girl, and vice versa.

117628869.review:
Virtual Cottage is not a game.  Games contain meaningful gamelike interaction and game loops, which are absent in this software.  This is a simple software "assistant" application that presents a hand drawn cottage, which is supposed to help you study or do your housework.  You can customise the appearance of the cottage in a couple of ways, change your pet from a cat to a dog, set the weather and time of day, and you can add an in-game "to-do" list to track whatever housework you have to do instead of wasting your time looking at a picture of a cottage.  [i]There's no actual interaction or gameplay, it's just a picture of a cottage.[/i]

For those unfamiliar with what actually makes something a game, a "game loop" describes the interaction and feedback a gamer has when playing a game.  Tetris, for example, has a game loop where a random block appears, the gamer interacts with the block to position it, and then the game decides if that finishes a row or not, increases the players score if any rows were completed, then gives the gamer another block to position.  Counter-Strike has a game loop where a player seeks another player, tests their skill against that player by shooting them or being shot, the computer rewards the player if they win, and then if the player survives, they repeat that loop.  There's no loop here, no true interactive feedback.  It simply is not a game, it cannot be "played". 

This has misleadingly been launched in the "Games" section of Steam instead of the "Software" section. This is a common mistake for developers who are new to Steam, or don't understand the difference between games and software which isn't a game.  It seems this software published incorrectly as a game is simply lack of experience/knowledge of the correct process.

Here's a link for the process to publish non-game software on Steam: 

[url=https://help.steampowered.com/en/wizard/HelpWithPublishing?issueid=925]Steam Developer Help With Software Publishing[/url]

It's unfortunate this process was not known about/followed, resulting in a software application being published in the wrong place.

Publishing things which aren't games on Steam in the Games section as games is misleading to gamers and somewhat harmful, because it pollutes the Steam marketplace and takes away visibility and market exposure for genuine game developers who do the right thing and make games for gamers.

There are no gameplay loops in this software, no "gameplay", no meaningful game like interaction. It's a software application and as such has no merits as a video game for gamers. Because of this, I cannot recommend this non-game software as a game to gamers.

- It has a timer. It helps me keep track of time of how long I've been working, and how long until I can get myself a break. You can select to switch on an option to alarm you when the timer has finished.
- A to-do list. You don't have to put the list of things you need to do on a paper, sticky note, or on another app.
- Customizable white noise. You can choose to switch on or off the noise of rain, snow, wind, and a fire place. You can adjust the volume of the white noise, and pick which one you'd listen to at the background.
- Lo-fi, relaxing music. The music in this app are all instrumental, perfect for not getting me distracted. You can switch it on and have it play with the white noise and adjust the music's volume.
- Cute graphics. I love how cute the app looks. It gives a really comfy vibe, and I like how the background changes according to real time. It doesn't have a super girly appearance, it just has a soft and comfy aesthetic to it.

Overall, this has helped me stay focused on my work. It has probably helped in increasing my productivity. I love how this does not have an distracting ads. I would say this helps me do my job faster because I don't take random breaks in between and I'm more efficient with my time using this app. Plus, it's free.

It's easy to get distracted while trying to get work done, but Virtual Cottage is a great way to assist with focusing on tasks. You can full screen the game so that you're only focusing on whatever task at hand, set a timer to get your work done, and you can choose to have a soft timer go off when your time ends. It's simple but very effective. I've used this for grad school work, grading, even tidying up the house. 

Some neat options include adding ambient sounds like rain & wind, and choosing between a doge or cat to accompany your avatar. I do wish you could customize your player & home a little, but that doesn't take away from the game.

My only real complaint is that some of the music is a little "harder" than I like, which interrupts me when I'm studying or working, but otherwise it's a great little experience. 

I definitely recommend it if you need some additional focus, or just want to chill a little with some lo-fi beats.

112838551.review:
The most important aspect of an application like this is that it takes up minimal system resources. This is important at least if you're doing work on your machine while this is running. Despite this application doing a minimal set of tasks, game engines tend to try to consume as many resources as possible, throttling any other application -- this of course is necessary for real-time games. Even an empty window can consume an entire thread. Of course this is something we want to benchmark for background applications such as these.

This application takes around 150-200Mb of RAM on Linux, probably comparable to Windows. This is probably acceptable on most systems. Spotify and YouTube consume at least that much RAM. CPU consumption is lower than spotify/youtube, and the GPU consumption is also relatively minimal.
